tier.item: Y pa al mosaico le apurabamos, que duro y duro y duro, y nos
arriaban los albaniles: ``Apurense, mosaiqueros, que no les vayamos
a ganar.'' Uhm . . . duramos -- ¿que?--unano . . . [ ] . . . ya teniamos
hartos apilos de alla a aca ... [ ] ... ``Apurenle, que ahora si ya
vamos a pegar mosaicos.''
`And with the mosaic we were le hurrying up [= really hurrying ] ,
real hard, and the construction workers would prod us ``Hurry up
se, mosaic layers, we're going to beat you.'' Uhm . . . we spent
what? -- a year. We already had lots of piles (of tiles) all over the
place . . . ``Hurry up le [= get on with it ] , now we're going to start
putting up tile.'' '

seguimos aqui.´
`I got married, and we continued. To this date. To this date
we le continue here (= we're still here together) '
Me case, y seguimos. Y hasta la fecha. Y hasta la fecha le
seguimos aqui.´
I got married, and we continued. To this date. To this date we le continue here (= we're still here together)

tier.item: Inf. A. ­¿Sobre que quieren hablar? ¿Que tema?
Inf. B. ­Pos si: ¿Que tema? Para poderle seguir.
`Informant A: What do you want to talk about? What topic?'
`Informant B: Yeah, what topic? So we can le continue

tier.item: Inf. ­Todo eso es lo que muchas veces uno no opina . . . uno
mas tarde tampoco lo puede uno decir.
Enc. ­ Si, ¡sigale!
`Informant: All this is what many times you don't give your
opinion about . . . not even later you can't say it.'
`Interviewer: Yes, continue le! (= go on) '
